title: What are some main differences between full spectrum autism disorder and narcissistic personality disorder? - Quora

response.answer_text: Autistic people, in general, are not good at picking up social cues. You'll never see a person with autism working a room. If they turn out to be charming and awesome, it was totally on accident. Narcissists are experts at picking up on cues, and they're always working the room.

Some people with classic autism can be quite delusional in their vivid fantasies of omnipotence, however they still have theory of mind deficits while a true narcissist has over active theory of mind and even sixth senses.
